strong.span: Click HERE for REMOTE LEARNING INFORMATION

br.br: The Ware Public School District strives to work with parents and the wider community to educate all students in an environment that supports high academic achievement, instills respect and fosters civic responsibility. We believe that the ultimate goal of education is to support students as successful lifelong learners.

video.source: Your browser does not support the video tag. If viewing on the app click here

div.a: Read More about Update from Dr. DiLeo 04172020

div.div: As you are aware, Covid 19 has greatly impacted our current educational model and our school schedule. the changes caused by Covid 19 have also led us to consider altering our school calendar.
div.a: Read More about School Calendar Survey

div.a: Read More about Update from Dr. DiLeo 04-06-2020

img.title: Policy Manual
img.span: Warning: Policy Manual Does Not Work With Internet Explorer. Click here to continue or here to close.

div.div: It is the policy of the Ware Public Schools not to discriminate on the basis of age, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, homelessness, military service, union activity or genetics in its educational programs, activities or employment policies as required by Title IX of the 1972 Education Amendments, Chapter 622 of the Massachusetts General Laws, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, the Equal Educational Opportunities Act of 1974, Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, M.G.L. c. 71A and c. 76, s. 5.
